page.title: 13ECOLOGY-SPECIAL INTEREST
page.content: The River Medina which runs through the middle of the area has been canalised below Shide meadow. It carries a heavy load of topsoil following heavy rains,but it does not appear otherwise badly polluted,though it must carry pesticide and fertilizer run off. There are 3 sites of interest in the area.Carisbrooke Castle has grounds which are mown but not sprayed and are botanically rich.The same is true of Mountjoy Cemetery.Shide Pit a former chalk pit is a {Site of Special {Scientific Interest}and is showing early stages of development of chalk grassland.Tree growth is well developed on the S.facing slope but in early stages on the others. There is also a{bat roost}in the former Newport to Sandown railway tunnel.
